Dialog.text: Hey, over here!
Listen. You run into any other fellas wearing an green jumpsuit ... watch your ass.
Are you a scientist?
My name's Aaron. Aaron Ingram.
Come... come closer.
Ah, hell, uh.
Let's talk.
You need guns? Ammo? I saw one of them science types go into that armory. Saw him punch in the code.
You get me out of here, I'll let you have it.
Find anything good in that armory?
I was gonna give you the code, but I guess you don't need it.
Still, I sure would appreciate being let out of here!
No reason to keep me locked up in here anymore.
C'mon, now, goddammit. Let me out!
All you gotta do is open the door.
Most of the other fellas were Russian. I speak a little, but as you can tell I ain't from there.
As you might'ave guessed.
You know I used to be a reverend? Training for it anyways.
Till I got locked up.
Behold, the wicked man conceives evil, is pregnant with mischief and gives birth to lies.
Does that sound like anybody you know?
I know my life ain't worth two dead crickets, but nobody deserves this.
Y'all really shit and fell backwards in it, huh?
Hey! Oh- whoa, whoa, whoa! Just what the hell are you doing?
What's that thing doing in there, huh?
Don't do it. Please, God, don't do it - I'm begging you. One human being to another, don't do it!
I know what it's like to cross that line. There ain't no coming back.
Godammit show me some mercy, you sick sonuvabitch.
Shit! You- I told you not to do it! Oh shit!
Now that's what I'm talking about! Some human decency, friend.
You're the one person that showed me any real kindness, and you can believe I won't forget it.
If you still want that code, it's 8714.
They ain't all decent human beings like me.
I'll just lay low for a bit. Plan a route outta here.
You look kind of familiar. You sure you ain't been here before?
I never seen creatures like that. Where'd they get 'em? Bottom of the ocean or something?
Oh! Lots of good stuff in here. Maybe there's a spare pistol.
I know there's something over there...
Ah, shit.
What was that?
You can't hide forever.
C'mon now. Let's see what you got.
Where in...
Oh, shit! That ain't right.
Lord have mercy. What kind of devil have you got inside you?
Dialog.notes: (Changed so when rerecording, works for male and female.)

Dialog.text: You sure there ain't some numbers scratched on your forehead? Add up to eighteen?
What are you doin'?
Can't say I understand your motive.
I thought we were square!
You left me no choice.
There it is!
You damn son of a-!
Gone now.
Woo! Whooped his ass good.
Probably ain't the last time.
(Cry of Relief) Somebody must be watchin' over me.
Oh, I got a real bad feelin'.
I expect we ain't gonna like what's comin'.
Kill it!
I seen one of the other volunteers come through here. A big guy. Bastard wouldn't let me out and now I'm glad he didn't.
Watched him bash some poor sucker's head in with a wrench. Kept going on and on about... black eggs and whatnot. Real disturbed.
Being here, you start to miss things. Things you gladly said good riddance to. Like this miniature poodle I used to have. Ugly as sin.
Little shit used to chew holes in my boots. (Sigh) Wonder what he's doin' now?
Hey, what you reading? My rap sheet? Huh?
I'm telling you, on my momma's grave that is a stack of lies meant to make pushing that button easier on you.
Ok fine, listen - I want to be honest - some of it probably is true. I done some wrong in my days.
But this ain't right, now. C'mon, y'all got to let me out of here.
I never did anything to those kids. I was just gettin'em out of a bad spot. That's all.
The real criminals - they didn't like how I was chipping away at their pile of rubles.
They got their claw sunk deep in the government. Got me shipped off to the gulag. That's how I ended up here. See?
I thought they wasn't gonna to let me in at first. On account of this volunteer get up.
Ha, ha! Thanks again for lettin' me out. I won't forget it. You're a real decent human being, Morgan Yu.
